newsitem.title: BELGIUM: More Belgian troops sent for possible evacuation.
newsitem.headline: More Belgian troops sent for possible evacuation.

text.p: Belgium has sent a further 54 paratroopers to Brazzaville, capital of the Congo, to assist in any evacuation of its nationals from the Zairean capital Kinshasa on the far bank of the river Congo.
Belgian radio reported the elite squad left the country on Wednesday night, raising to more than 700 the number of Belgium troops now ready to take part in "Operation Greenstream".

Belgium, the former colonial power in Zaire, has recommended its nationals leave the country. But several hundred -- many missionaries -- are believed to have stayed despite a rebel army drive on Kinshasa.
